ageSorting.ageGroup3: Age Sorting for age group under 12

viewNames.testResultModal: How do I add my result?

whyUse.title: You are helping others
whyUse.text:
Using the app will help all of us in Scotland by stopping or slowing the spread of COVID-19.

This supports the existing contact tracing process and helps us avoid lockdowns.

By using this app you are helping us stay safe, save lives and protect Scotland.

yourData.title: Be the first to know
yourData.text:
If you are in close contact with an app user who has told their app that they have COVID-19, you will get an alert. This will ask you to self-isolate because you may have been infected and should avoid giving it to other people.

The app won't tell you who or where it was.

modal.title: What is close contact?
modal.content:
The app uses Bluetooth to check if your phone is near others with the app. **Close contact means you were near them for 15 minutes or more over a 24 hour period.**

**It doesn’t track your location.** This protects everyone’s privacy and only uses a very small amount of battery.

If you get an alert to say you have been in close contact with someone this is how it will pop up on your screen:
modal.notificationIllustrationAlt: Illustration of example notification on phone showing that you have been in close contact with a person who has COVID-19.

testResult.title: Getting a test result
testResult.text:
If you test positive for COVID-19 you (or your parent/carer if you’re under 16) will be contacted by the contact tracing team. **They will give you a test result code to put into this app.**

Putting the code into this app will release the Random IDs your phone has collected over the last 14 days.

Other app users you’ve been close to will then be alerted. **They will not be told where it happened, or that it was you.**
testResult.buttonLabel: How do I add my result?
testResult.buttonHint: Shows details about how to add test result

modal.content: **The contact tracing team will give you a test result code to put into this app.** If you get it by SMS it will look like this:
modal.content1:
When you put your test code into this app you will be asked to share the 'Random IDs’ that your phone has been swapping with other app users over the last 14 days. This will allow us to tell those people that they have been exposed to COVID-19, but not who you are.

**We will never ask you to reply to the SMS text message.** Please ignore any message asking you to reply or send information.

accessibility.howToAddResultHint: Learn How you can add your result.
accessibility.howToAddResultLabel: How do I add my result?
accessibility.messageIllustrationAlt: Illustration of example message on phone showing that you tested positive for COVID-19.

privacy.title: Nobody else will know
privacy.text:
The app will never track your identity or location, but it does collect some statistics.

We will know the total number of app users, the number of people in Scotland who enter a test result code, and the number of app users who are notified that they have been exposed to COVID-19.

notice.title: This app uses automated processing
notice.subtitle: Please do this next bit with your parent or carer

text.default: Meaning computers, not people, will decide whether or not you are asked to self-isolate. The way it works has been designed and tested by people. We need to check that you are OK with it.
text.ageGroup3: **Automated processing** means computers, not people, will decide whether or not you are asked to self-isolate. The way it works has been designed and tested by people. We need to check that you are OK with it.

notice.additionalText: If you are unsure about what this means, please speak to a parent or carer.

consent.default: Do you consent to receiving automated instructions to 'self-isolate' from this app?
consent.ageGroup3: Do you give consent to your child receiving automated instructions to ‘self-isolate’ from this app?

view.intro:
So that you can use this app when travelling outside Scotland we may securely share Random IDs with similar apps used in other parts of the world.

This also means that people using those apps will be able to keep using them when visiting Scotland

title.default: Are you happy to start using this app?
title.ageGroup2: Having spoken to your parent or carer are you happy to use this app?

view.tc: If you tap ‘Yes’ you are accepting the Terms & Conditions.
view.optOut:

To do this select ‘Leave’ in ‘Settings’ in this app.

confirm.text: If you do not consent to automated processing, you will not be able to use this app

ios.title: Please update Apple iOS to use this app
ios.text1: You need to do this to use the ‘Exposure Notification Service’ created by Apple to help make apps like this work and stop COVID-19.

android.title: Please update Google Play Services to use this app
android.text1: You need to do this to use the ‘Exposure Notification Service’ created by Google to help make apps like this work and stop COVID-19.

view.title: Setting up your phone
view.text:
Next, you will be asked for your permission to enable contact tracing technologies and notifications for this app. Make sure Bluetooth is on.

**Please give your permission so that the app can work properly.**

tracing.heading: Tracing
tracing.body: If you are in close contact with an app user who has tested positive for COVID-19 and added that result to their app, this app will notify you.
tracing.additional: For additional guidance about using this app in different environments, please see [FAQs]({{ link }})
tracing.message: You can close this app and tracing will keep working. If you want to stop tracing and opt out select ‘Leave’ from the ‘Settings’ menu in this app.
tracing.inactiveMessage: Tracing is not active, so this app won’t work. To fix this go to your device ‘Settings’ and turn on:
tracing.inactiveMessage1: If you want to stop tracing and opt out select **‘Leave’** from the **‘Settings’** menu in this app.
tracing.notificationBody: You have been in **close contact with someone who has COVID-19**

paused.title: Paused
paused.text: Tracing is not active, so this app is not exchanging any data with other users’ apps.
paused.buttonHint: Restarts contact tracing after being paused

community.heading: Share and Protect
community.body: Contact tracing is more effective when more people use this app. Invite others to download the app and help protect our community.

about.heading: About this App
about.link: Read more about this app and the technology used

whyUse.title: Why use this contact tracing app?
whyUse.main: Using it will help all of us in Scotland by stopping or slowing the spread of COVID-19. This supports NHS Scotland and helps us avoid lockdowns.
whyUse.text: By using this app you are helping us stay safe, save lives and protect Scotland. **Thank you.**

yourData.textBell: **If you are in close contact** with an app user who has added a positive COVID-19 test code to their app, this app will notify you. **You won’t know who or where.**
yourData.textUnion: **If you test positive for COVID-19** you will be contacted by the contact tracing team, who will provide you with a test result code to add to this app. This will trigger notifications to other app users that you have been in close contact with. **This app will never reveal your identity or location.**

privacy.title: How is my privacy protected?
privacy.textKey: If you test positive for COVID-19 a contact tracer will call you. As part of the call they will send you a **Test Result Code** by SMS text message from **'TestProtect'**. When you put that code into this app you will be asked if you want to share the Random IDs (encrypted, anonymised random keys) that your mobile phone has been exchanging with other app users’ mobile phones over the last {{ tracePeriod }} days. If you agree, these **'diagnosis keys'** will allow us to notify those app users that they have been exposed to COVID-19.
privacy.textKey1: **We will never ask you to reply to the SMS text message.** Please ignore any message asking you to reply or send information.
privacy.textEye:
You are able to securely share ‘diagnosis keys’ with other countries – so you are able to use this app when visiting other countries. This also allows apps used by visitors from those countries to work here.

This app will never track your identity or location, but it does collect some statistics. NHS Scotland will know the total number of app users, the number of people in Scotland who enter a Test Result Code, and the number of app users who are notified that they have been exposed to COVID-19. We need this data to prove that the app works, and comply with regulators.

text.ageGroup2: This will protect others. You should self-isolate for the whole time shown above.

step4.text: Try to avoid contact with other people in your house.

tests.heading: Add Test Code
tests.content: If you test positive for COVID-19 you can add that result to this app and alert others. This will never reveal your identity or location.
tests.illustrationLabel: Woman using app to add test result
tests.modalContent: App users you have been in close contact with will be told that they have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 but won’t know who it was
tests.permissionError: We have not uploaded your keys as you did not grant permission.
tests.uploadError: An error occurred trying to upload

code.error: There was an error validating the code. Please try again.

add.assistanceMessage: Please contact [{{ contactTracingNumber }}](tel:{{ contactTracingNumberTrimmed }}) to request a new code
add.heading: Add Test Code
add.description:
You should only enter a Test Result Code if you have tested positive for COVID-19.

The code is the 6 digit number given to you by the National Contact Tracing Centre.

Contact [{{ contactTracingNumber }}](tel:{{ contactTracingNumberTrimmed }})  if you don’t have a code.
add.uploadOnlyDescription:
Test Code was already added.
You just need to submit it.

result.heading: Thank you.
result.advice: You should follow the advice given to you by the Contact Tracer.
result.text1: Your identity will NOT be shared. Your personal data or any identifiable information will NOT be shared.
result.text2: **Your random IDs have NOT been shared. App users you have been in close contact with will NOT be notified that they have been exposed to someone with COVID-19.**
result.resubmitLabel: I've changed my mind and wish to warn/protect others
result.resubmitHint: I've changed my mind and wish to warn / protect others

view.heading: Add Test Result
view.description: You have verified that you have tested positive for COVID-19. You should self-isolate for 7 days from the start of your symptoms.
view.tellMore: I’ve tested positive. Tell me more about self-isolation.

clearData.message: Want to get rid of your close contact alert?

action.label: Clear Close Contact Alert
action.hint: Buttons clears your Clear Close Contact Alert and all exposure service data on your device

clearData.confirmText: Are you sure you want to clear all your Close Contacts?
clearData.error: There was an error clearing your Close Contacts. Please try again.

leave.title: Leave
leave.body:
Thank you for helping to fight COVID-19. We’re sorry to see you go. When you tap ‘I want to leave’ we will remove all data stored by the app from your device.

Random IDs created or collected by Exposure Notification Services cannot be removed by this app. If you want to remove these, do this through your device ‘Settings’.

control.label: I want to leave
control.hint: Exits the app and deletes all data

confirm.title: Leave
confirm.text: Are you sure you want to leave?

leave.error: There was an error clearing your data. Please try again or contact us.

terms.title: Terms & Conditions
terms.body: The full details of the Terms & Conditions can be read at [protect.scot website]({{ link }})

dataPolicy.title: Data Privacy Information Notice
dataPolicy.body: The full details of the privacy notice can be read at [protect.scot website]({{ link }})

pause.title: Pause Tracing
pause.body: There are some situations where you may wish to temporarily suspend proximity tracing, e.g. if you work in a clinical setting, wearing medical grade PPE.
pause.label: For more information see [FAQs]({{ link }})

reminder.title: REMINDER: Restart Tracing
reminder.message: Tap here to open the app. Then tap `Restart Tracing` to activate contact tracing

newVersion.title: A new version of this app is available on the {{storeName}}

calculator.heading: How is my self-isolation time calculated?
calculator.dynamicText: The government and scientists agree that people should self-isolate for 14 days from the day they were exposed to someone with COVID-19.
calculator.body:
**This app doesn’t know where you were exposed or the exact time, but it does know the date on which it happened.**

So it uses this exposure date to tell you how many more days you still need to self-isolate.
calculator.highlight: This means you only have to self-isolate for the number of days shown in the app.

sendNotice.heading: Prove that you need to self-isolate
sendNotice.body:
You can send a certificate proving you need to self-isolate to other people and organisations, e.g. your employer.

**You can only do this once, but you can send it to more than one person or organisation.**

The certificate will be sent by email so you need email addresses for the people and organisations you want to notify.
